definitions.title: n. pr. m.
definitions.body: Eber (perh. eponym of Hebrews, form inferred from [[עִבְרִי]], cf. reff. there);—

‘ son ’ of Shelaḥ, and ‘ grandson ’ of Arpachshad Ge 10:24 (J) = 1Ch 1:18, Ge 11:14, Ge 11:15 (P); ‘ father ’ of Peleg and Joktan Ge 10:25 (J; with esp. ref. to Joktan v:Ge 10:26 ff., i.e. to Arabians) = 1Ch 1:19 (cf. v:1Ch 1:20 ff.), of Peleg specif. Ge 11:16, Ge 11:17 (P; with esp. ref. to Abr. v:Ge 11:26 f.) cf. 1Ch 1:25 (see v:1Ch 1:27 f.); in Ge 10:21 (J) Shem is called [[אֲבִי כָּל־בְּנֵי־עֵבֶר]]; LXX Eber.— ´[[ע]] Nu 24:24 perh. (si vera l.) belongs not here ( = [[עִבְרִים]] Hebrews, LXX )Ebrai/ouv, so Thes), but sub I. [[עֵבֶר]] = the (land) beyond (the river), ‖[[אַשּׁוּר]], so Di Kau.
a Gadite chief 1Ch 5:13, LXX Wbhd, LXXL Eber.

definitions.title: b.
definitions.body: 1Ch 8:22 ([[עֵבֶר]] van d. H. Ginsb; [[עֶבֶד]] Baer), LXX Wbdh, A Wbhd, LXXL Aber.
